p: Out of the 1,380 schools sampled, 1,365 were valid and 96.2% agreed to participate in the study. The proportion of non-response was 3.8%, which included refusals (2.6%) and schools not visited or closed down (1.2%). Of these, 16,391 (65.2%) agreed to provide a blood specimen for HIV testing. The proportions of HIV testing non-response included educators who were interviewed but refused to provide a blood sample (20.3%), educators who refused to be interviewed or to provide a blood sample (5.9%), educators who were present at school but not available to participate (8.0%), and educators who were absent from school on the day of data collection (0.6%) [ 15].
